abstract.text: An object that filters which address options to include or exclude in search results.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use this object to filter search results by criteria, such as country, region, and municipality. See

abstract.text: Display map or satellite imagery within your app, call out points of interest, and determine placemark information for map coordinates.
An object that filters which address options to include or exclude in search results.
A structure that contains options for filtering results in a search.
Indicates whether options are excluded from filtering.
A list of categories to exclude from a search.
Indicates whether options are included for filtering.
A list of categories to include in a search.
Creates an address filter with options for excluding results in a search.
Creates an address filter with options for including results in a search.
A structured request to use when searching for points of interest.
A utility object for initiating map-based searches and processing the results.
Options that indicate types of search results.
A utility object for generating a list of completion strings based on a partial search string that you provide.
Options that indicate types of search completions.
A fully formed string that completes a partial string.
A value that indicates the importance of the configured region.
Provide automatic search completions for a partial search query, search the map for relevant locations nearby, and retrieve details for selected points of interest.

doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/Map.title: Interacting with nearby points of interest

abstract.text: The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
